intro: Phanera bidentata subsp. bicornuta, commonly known as the two-toothed phanera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive two-toothed leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in yellow or greenish-yellow hues. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is known for its hairy stems and lobed foliage. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
